description: Genesis (type 1) should be valid for transaction with no inputs
Genesis (type 65) should be valid for transaction with no inputs
Genesis (type 129) should be invalid for transaction with no inputs
When the input is an SLP-invalid BCH-only tx, the token type 1 GENESIS tx should be SLP-valid.
When the inputs are an SLP-invalid BCH-only tx and an SLP-valid GENESIS tx (spending its token output), the SEND tx should be SLP-valid.
When the inputs are an SLP-invalid BCH-only tx and an SLP-valid GENESIS tx (spending both its token AND baton output), the SEND tx should be SLP-valid.
When the inputs are an SLP-invalid BCH-only tx and an SLP-valid GENESIS tx (spending only its baton output), the SEND tx should be SLP-invalid.
When the inputs are an SLP-invalid BCH-only tx and an SLP-valid GENESIS tx (spending only its baton output), the MINT tx should be SLP-valid.
When the inputs are an SLP-invalid BCH-only tx and an SLP-valid GENESIS tx (spending only its baton output), the MINT tx should be SLP-invalid since version/type changed.
When the inputs are an SLP-invalid BCH-only tx and an SLP-valid GENESIS tx (spending both its token AND baton output), the MINT tx should be SLP-valid.
When the inputs are an SLP-invalid BCH-only tx and an SLP-valid GENESIS tx (spending its token output), the MINT tx should be SLP-invalid.
When the input is an SLP-invalid BCH-only tx, the token type 129 (NFT1 parent) GENESIS tx should be SLP-valid.
When the first input is an SLP-valid NFT1 parent GENESIS tx, the NFT1 child GENESIS tx w/ qty=1 should be SLP-valid.
When the second input is an SLP-valid NFT1 parent GENESIS tx, the NFT1 child GENESIS tx w/ qty=1 should be SLP-invalid.
When the fist input is change output from a SLP-valid NFT1 parent GENESIS tx and second second input is an SLP-valid NFT1 parent GENESIS tx, the NFT1 child GENESIS tx w/ qty=1 should be SLP-invalid.
When the fist input is change output from a SLP-valid NFT1 parent SEND tx and second second input is an SLP-valid NFT1 parent SEND tx, the NFT1 child GENESIS tx w/ qty=1 should be SLP-invalid.
When the fist input is change output from a SLP-valid NFT1 parent MINT tx and second second input is an SLP-valid NFT1 parent MINT tx, the NFT1 child GENESIS tx w/ qty=1 should be SLP-invalid.
When the fist input is the mint baton from a SLP-valid NFT1 parent MINT tx and second second input is an SLP-valid NFT1 parent MINT tx, the NFT1 child GENESIS tx w/ qty=1 should be SLP-invalid.
When the input is an SLP-invalid BCH-only tx, the token type 129 (NFT1 parent) GENESIS qty 0 tx should be SLP-valid.
When the first input is an SLP-valid NFT1 parent GENESIS tx w/ 0 output, the NFT1 child GENESIS tx w/ qty=1 should be SLP-invalid.
When the first input is an SLP-valid token type 1 GENESIS tx w/ 2 output, the NFT1 child GENESIS tx w/ qty=1 should be SLP-invalid because of wrong parent type.
When SLP-valid NFT1 parent inputs, 0 quantity NFT1 child SEND must pass
When SLP-valid NFT1 child inputs, 0 quantity NFT1 child SEND must pass
When SLP-invalid inputs, 0 quantity NFT1 child SEND must pass
When SLP-valid inputs, NFT1 child with multi-outputs with output quanitiy = 1 must pass
When SLP-valid inputs after multi-output SEND, NFT1 child SEND quanitiy = 1 must pass
When the token input amounts are (2**64-100, 1000000) and the SEND outputs exactly this amount, the SEND tx should be SLP-valid (output summation must not use 64-bit integers that overflow).
When the token input amounts are (2**64-100, 1000000) and the SEND outputs exceed this by 1 token, the SEND tx should be SLP-invalid.
When the token input amounts are (2**64-100, 1000000) and the SEND outputs fall short by 1 token, the SEND tx should be SLP-valid.
When the token input amounts are (2**64-100, 1000000) and the SEND outputs are very small numbers, the SEND tx should be SLP-valid.
When the token input amounts are (2**64-100, 1000000) but the sum of SEND outputs exceeds this (even when the token outputs will be truncated), the SEND tx should be SLP-invalid.
When given two inputs of differing token_id, the SEND should be SLP-valid because it spends less than the matching token_id
When given two inputs of differing token_id, the SEND should be SLP-invalid because it spends more than the tokens of matching token_id
When given two inputs of differing token_id, the SEND should be SLP-invalid because it spends more than the tokens of matching token_id
When given two SLP-valid inputs, the SEND should be SLP-valid since it outputs as much as the valid inputs
When given two SLP-valid inputs from the same txid, the SEND should be SLP-valid since it outputs as much as the valid inputs
When given two SLP-valid inputs from the same txid, the SEND should be SLP-invalid since it outputs more than the valid inputs
When given two SLP-valid inputs from the same txid, the SEND should be SLP-valid since it outputs less than the valid inputs
When given two SLP-valid type 0x01 inputs, the SEND should be SLP-invalid since token version/type changed to NFT1 child type (having fake child NFT1 GENESIS txid)
When given two SLP-valid type 0x01 inputs, the SEND should be SLP-invalid since token version/type changed to NFT1 child type (having a valid child NFT1 GENESIS txid)
When given two SLP-valid type 0x01 inputs, the SEND should be SLP-invalid since token version/type changed to NFT1 parent type (having fake child GENESIS txid)
When given two SLP-valid inputs, the SEND should be SLP-invalid since it outputs more than the valid inputs
When given one SLP-valid input and another SLP-invalid input, the SEND should be SLP-valid since it outputs as much as the valid input
When given one SLP-valid input and another SLP-invalid input, the SEND should be SLP-invalid since it outputs more than the valid input
When given one SLP-valid input and another SLP-invalid input, the SEND should be SLP-valid since it outputs as much as the valid input
When given one SLP-valid input and another SLP-invalid input, the SEND should be SLP-invalid since it outputs more than the valid input
When given two SLP-invalid inputs, the SEND should be SLP-valid since it outputs 0 tokens
When given two SLP-valid inputs, the SEND should be SLP-valid even though it outputs 0 tokens
When given valid tokens, the SEND with multiple OP_RETURNS should be SLP-valid based on the vout=0 OP_RETURN
When given valid tokens, the SEND with multiple OP_RETURNS should be SLP-invalid based on the vout=0 OP_RETURN
When taking 100 tokens, the SEND should be SLP-invalid since it outputs 225 tokens.
When taking SLP-invalid tokens, the SEND should be SLP-invalid since it sends >0 tokens.
When SEND splits tokens from MINT, should be SLP-valid.
When SEND splits tokens from MINT, a further SEND should be SLP-valid.
When SEND splits tokens from MINT, a further SEND should be SLP-invalid since it over-outputs.
When SEND splits tokens from MINT, an eventual SEND merging the tokens should be SLP-valid.
When MINT spends baton to another MINT baton, should be SLP-valid.
When MINT spends baton to another MINT baton, should be SLP-invalid due to invalid baton parent.
When MINT spends baton to another MINT baton, should be SLP-invalid due to token version/type mismatch.
When MINT spends two batons, one invalid at vin=0 and the other valid at vin=1.
